pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw:
To test extended periods of walking, I'm using the keyboard_teleop script with the following modification to take more steps:
~~~
$ diff keyboard_teleop.py ~/osrf/drcsim_2.6/ros/atlas_utils/scripts/keyboard_teleop.py 
250c250
<         for i in range(100*self.params["Walk Sequence Length"]["value"]):
---
>         for i in range(self.params["Walk Sequence Length"]["value"]):
~~~
content.html:
To test extended periods of walking, I'm using the keyboard_teleop script with the following modification to take more steps:

$ diff keyboard_teleop.py ~/osrf/drcsim_2.6/ros/atlas_utils/scripts/keyboard_teleop.py 
250c250
<         for i in range(100*self.params["Walk Sequence Length"]["value"]):
---
>         for i in range(self.params["Walk Sequence Length"]["value"]):

pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw: I think if you press `e` + `0` then the number of steps can be set nearly infinitely large.
content.html: I think if you press e + 0 then the number of steps can be set nearly infinitely large.

pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw: This seems to be okay. The only problem I have is that a static step forward (I) must be followed by a static step left (J) in order to make forward progress.
content.html: This seems to be okay. The only problem I have is that a static step forward (I) must be followed by a static step left (J) in order to make forward progress.

pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw: yes, that keyboard teleop function has not been implemented, I usually test by directly doing rostopic pub to `/atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command`.
content.html: yes, that keyboard teleop function has not been implemented, I usually test by directly doing rostopic pub to /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command.

pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw: I have a concern about merging this so late in the game. Mainly we only have one more day of the Practice Session and would like to be spending that time testing our algorithms. We feel that we've worked around this issue, and we would feel very nervous about using a different version of the library, even if it supposedly does not change the Multi-Step behavior, which we are using. We've all experienced those times where we make a change in one place and it causes some bug to pop up in another place. @bchevalier, the reporter of this issue, is also on our team.
content.html: I have a concern about merging this so late in the game. Mainly we only have one more day of the Practice Session and would like to be spending that time testing our algorithms. We feel that we've worked around this issue, and we would feel very nervous about using a different version of the library, even if it supposedly does not change the Multi-Step behavior, which we are using. We've all experienced those times where we make a change in one place and it causes some bug to pop up in another place. @bchevalier, the reporter of this issue, is also on our team.

pullrequest.title: new atlas sim interface 1.1.1 with yawed step fix issue #311

content.raw:
Given other issues that will likely require and update, would it be possible to get this pulled into drcsim-nightly so that we can test without requiring a build from source.

At this point, the STEP interface is unusable, so if people aren't happy with results they don't need to use that mode.
Merging this is the only way to get access to this functionality.
content.html:
Given other issues that will likely require and update, would it be possible to get this pulled into drcsim-nightly so that we can test without requiring a build from source.

At this point, the STEP interface is unusable, so if people aren't happy with results they don't need to use that mode. Merging this is the only way to get access to this functionality.

content.raw:
A pre-release for this branch has been built for testing.
~~~
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install drcsim-prerelease
~~~
should do it.

should do it.
